data.title: Top Notch Craft Beer!
data.text: Been all over Eugene the past two days and this place is our fave! Great atmosphere, excellent service, and the beer is outstanding! Try the Filbert Brown, Crankshaft IPA, and Timmy the Wretched Bourbon Barrel-Aged. You will be glad you came over!!!

data.title: Worth the stop
data.text: The beer was pretty good and bartender was friendly.  Went at closing and still a decent atmosphere.  Would have liked to spent some more time there.

data.title: Local Micro Brews
data.text: Tidy little brew pub that's been open for a while now and getting a following.  Try some local flavor not available at stores.

data.title: Love this place.
data.text: Great bar. They have a really good food selection and the best huckleberry mead... try the hummus. It's my favorite.

data.title: Awesome Atmosphere
data.text: They had a greek meal special going on so my husband tried that. We were there while there was a live "bluegrass" band. I really enjoyed the music!!! I just got a sandwich with my beer but we both liked our meals and of course the beers were also good. We will be going back, we had a great time. :)

data.title: Delicious beer
data.text: In town for only a little bit and wanted to grab a local pint. My hotel was right by this gem. It's decorated so cute with local historical items AND the beer was great too. I had the Filbert Brown and it was so creamy and good.

data.title: Nice tasting room with good food and beer
data.text: I've been here numerous times and the servise is always excellent, the beers are top notch, and the food is tasty. It's kind of tucked away from most foot and car traffic due to construction but is definitely worth the little extra effort to get too.

data.title: Heading Upwards
data.text:
In the great tradition of brewery and food-cart combinations (e.g. Ninkasi, Oakshire), we can now add Sam Bond’s Brewing to Eugene’s repertoire.  I accidentally discovered SB while breezing through Eugene several months ago.  Even in that short time they’ve started to flesh out their operation. 
 
The first thing you will notice is that the area is very pristine, even with construction.  Cool-looking but lifeless buildings look down at SB’s wood-paneled abode.  It’s a little island of quiet, and best of all, parking was not an issue either of the two times I swung by.  The outdoor seating on the sidewalk is perfect for catching rays. 
 
The beers suffice.  Good microbrew stuff.  Atmosphere is pleasant.  Seems like a locals’ hangout in that everybody there appeared to know one another.  The newness of everything is what grabbed me. 
 
Saying all that, it’s still hard to get a definitive read on them.  I like food carts in general, but their unpredictability can be a turn-off.  Case in point, another brewery I swung by had a cart specializing in wings.  Which I love, but at that particular moment was not what I sought.  On my second venture to SB, some Costa Rican dude was setting up his cart.  But, he wasn’t open yet, we were starving, and hence in a dilemma.  Hopefully they can get that sorted out. 
 
Still, thumbs up.  They are off to a good start.
